meanings.definition: To predict or foretell future events.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys prophesying about the weather.
meanings.sent2: The old man was prophesying the arrival of a great storm.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to be prophesying that it would rain by staring out the window.
meanings.sent4: The fortune teller was prophesying the fate of the kingdom.
meanings.sent5: The ancient book was filled with prophecies, prophesying the rise and fall of empires.

meanings.sent1: The wise man was prophesying to the villagers about the importance of unity.
meanings.sent2: The priest was prophesying the word of God to the congregation.
meanings.sent3: The child playfully pretended to be prophesying the future to his friends.
meanings.sent4: The speaker was prophesying a message of hope and peace to the audience.
meanings.sent5: The prophet was prophesying the coming of a great leader who would bring prosperity to the land.

meanings.definition: To make a prediction or forecast.
meanings.sent1: The meteorologist was prophesying heavy rain for the weekend.
meanings.sent2: The economist was prophesying a recession in the upcoming months.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to be prophesying a harsh winter by gathering extra nuts.
meanings.sent4: The psychic was prophesying a major life change for the client.
meanings.sent5: The ancient text was prophesying the rise of a new civilization in the distant future.
